definitions.definition: A type, race or category; a group of entities that have common characteristics such that they may be grouped together.
definitions.example: This is a strange kind of tobacco.

definitions.definition: A makeshift or otherwise atypical specimen.
definitions.example: The opening served as a kind of window.

definitions.definition: One's inherent nature; character, natural disposition.
Goods or services used as payment, as e.g. in barter.
Equivalent means used as response to an action.
definitions.example: I'll pay in kind for his insult.

definitions.definition: Each of the two elements of the communion service, bread and wine.
